title: How to Make Mango and Passion Fruit Salad

steps.headline: Peel the mango, cut up the pieces and place them in a bowl.
steps.description: You can use more than one of you want more of a mango flavour.

steps.headline: Slice a passion fruit in half and spoon out all of the seeds into the bowl.
steps.description: You want to get it on top of the mango because they go brilliantly together.

steps.headline: Squeeze a satsuma or orange and get all the juice out into the bowl.
steps.description: You can make any leftovers into a juice drink.

steps.headline: Add in the strawberries and raspberries on top.
steps.description: They will make the juice from the watermelon or satsuma taste nice and sweet.

steps.headline: Add in some paper umbrellas, straws and ice cubes for a summery effect.
steps.description: They should look a bit like cocktails.

steps.headline: Pour into some jars and tie them with ribbons.
steps.description: Give them to your friends and family as a nice summer treat.

text: Peel the mango, cut up the pieces and place them in a bowl. You can use more than one of you want more of a mango flavour. Slice a passion fruit in half and spoon out all of the seeds into the bowl. You want to get it on top of the mango because they go brilliantly together. Squeeze a satsuma or orange and get all the juice out into the bowl. You can make any leftovers into a juice drink. Add in the strawberries and raspberries on top. They will make the juice from the watermelon or satsuma taste nice and sweet. Add in some paper umbrellas, straws and ice cubes for a summery effect. They should look a bit like cocktails. Pour into some jars and tie them with ribbons. Give them to your friends and family as a nice summer treat.
